Html:
Hello!

I installed SQL Server 2008. Based on this adventureworks DB and adventureworks BI (both worked).
I maked some mistakes during the setup of the SQL server - so i uninstalled it and installed it again.
I dont uninstalled adventureworks DB and adventureworks BI.
After the SQL Server Setup the resetup of the adventureworks DB works fine - but ...

... i am not able to reinstall (repair / modify / uninstall) the adventureworks BI ... any hints ?


THX

The database should still be there so I think all you need to do is to attache them...
1. go into SQL management console and connect to your new install.
2. expand to databases right click and select attach.
3. select add and you shuld get a dialog to browse for the files.
4.  The samples will be in something like program files\microsoft SQL server\100\tools\samples\*.mdf

when I do this using SQL 2005 and using the correct directory, I get "could not find row in sysindexes for database id 7, objectid 1, index1. Run DBCC checktable on sysindexes"  Well the simple question is how do I run checktable on a db i'm trying to attach?  is there something else I need todo?

thanks.
murphymj, if you still need help with this, please send me a private message and I'll work with you offline.

Thanks for the tip Andrew...  I had installed/uninstalled/re-installed SQL Server 2008; I had also re-installed the AdventureWorks db, but I either didn't do the uninstall for those correctly or there was a problem when I did the re-install of the data, because the files wouldn't show up in the database list in SSMS...  I was able to successfully re-attach as you suggested.  Note that the files were found in:

    C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10.MSSQLSERVER\MSSQL\DATA
